newsitem.title: ITALY: Details of third tranche sale of Eni shares.
newsitem.headline: Details of third tranche sale of Eni shares.

text.p: The Italian Treasury on Saturday completed the biggest placement of shares in its history, with the third tranche offer of stock in energy group Eni.
Here are details of the sale:
-- 858 million shares sold to retail investors in Italy, including 68 million shares for Eni employees.
-- Retail investors pay 9,288 lire per share, a three percent discount on Eni's closing price on the Milan bourse on Friday. Eni employees pay 9,192 lire, a four percent discount.
-- 407 million shares sold to institutions, of which:
U.S. and Canadians institutions get 136 million.
Institutions in the rest of the world get 72
-- In addition, 143 million shares, or 11.3 percent of the global placement, will be offered to the institutional investors under the terms of the greenshoe over-allotment clause.
-- Institutions will pay 9,575 lire per share -- Eni's closing price on Friday.
-- If all the greenshoe is taken up, the Treasury will make 13.3 trillion lire from the sale. If none is taken up, the Treasury will have raised 11.9 trillion lire.
-- The Treasury can offer a fourth tranche in Eni six months after the closure of the third tranche sale.
